RESOLVED_ENTITIES.U.S. Code Cong. & Admin.News: Official publication of US Congressional and Administrative materials
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Supreme Court: Supreme Court of the United States

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juventino Mejia-Orosco: Defendant convicted of illegally transporting aliens into the United States, claimed sentence was too long
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: Court that imposes sentences, judges witness credibility, has fact-finding power in sentencing procedure, and is subject to review by the court of appeals, found offense level 7 did not reflect crime's nature, justified a 2-level increase based on guidelines, made finding on Juventino Mejia-Orosco's role as 'an organizer, leader, manager, or supervisor', imposes sentences and makes factual findings, responsible for clarifying ultimate factual findings
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: Country where aliens were transported, also referred to as 'the government' in the context of law enforcement and sentencing
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission: Promulgated guidelines for sentencing used by the district court in calculating Juventino Mejia-Orosco's sentence, responsible for guidelines used in sentencing, specifies guidelines for sentencing, sought to ensure district courts consider all relevant factors
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals: Reviews the record, determines sentence validity, and remands cases for further sentencing proceedings if necessary, guides reviewing courts to the evidentiary basis for sentencing judgments
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Congress: Legislative body that enacted sentencing guidelines to reduce disparity in punishment and ensure fair sentences
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Senate Report: Official report of the US Senate, contains information about Juventino Mejia-Orosco's case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Official publication of US Congressional: Compilation of official US Congressional and Administrative documents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Sentencing Commission Guid: Guidelines providing a framework for district courts to impose sentences, considering various factors for fairness and appropriateness
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: Recognized findings as factual and held that certain questions are factual, including whether cause exists to dismiss a venireman and the existence of discrimination
